marauroa.server.db.adapter

Interface DatabaseAdapter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDatabaseAdapter, H2DatabaseAdapter, MySQLDatabaseAdapter, PostgresDatabaseAdapter

    public interface DatabaseAdapter
    adapter for a database system
    Author:
    hendrik

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      closes the database connection

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        void commit()
     throws java.sql.SQLException
        commits the current transaction
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • rollback

        void rollback()
       throws java.sql.SQLException
        rolls the current transaction back, undoing all the changes.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • execute

        int execute(java.lang.String sql)
     throws java.sql.SQLException
        executes an SQL statement
        Parameters:
        sql - sql-statement to execute
        Returns:
        number of affected rows
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • execute

        int execute(java.lang.String sql,
            java.io.InputStream... inputStreams)
     throws java.sql.SQLException,
            java.io.IOException
        executes an SQL statement with streamed parameters
        Parameters:
        sql - sql-statement to execute
        inputStreams - parameters
        Returns:
        number of affected rows
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error
        java.io.IOException - in case the stream cannot be read to the end

      • executeBatch

        void executeBatch(java.lang.String sql,
                  java.io.InputStream... inputStreams)
           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                  java.io.IOException
        executes a batch of sql-statements
        Parameters:
        sql - sql-statement to execute
        inputStreams - a list of input stream. For each of them the statement is executed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error
        java.io.IOException - in case one of the streams cannot be read to the end

      • query

        java.sql.ResultSet query(java.lang.String sql)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        queries the database for information
        Parameters:
        sql - sql-statement to execute
        Returns:
        ResultSet
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • querySingleCellInt

        int querySingleCellInt(java.lang.String sql)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        queries for a single row, single column integer response like a count-select
        Parameters:
        sql - sql-statement to execute
        Returns:
        integer of the first column in the first row
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • getLastInsertId

        int getLastInsertId(java.lang.String table,
                    java.lang.String idcolumn)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        gets the id of the last insert. Note: The table and idcolumn parameters must match the last insert statement. This is because on some database systems a SELECT IDENTITY is performed and on other database systems a SELECT curval(table_idcolumn_seq).
        Parameters:
        table - name of table on which the last insert was done
        idcolumn - name autoincrement serial column of that table
        Returns:
        generated id
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • close

        void close()
    throws java.sql.SQLException
        closes the database connection
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

        java.sql.PreparedStatement prepareStatement(java.lang.String sql)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Prepares a statement for a batch operation.
        Parameters:
        sql - SQL statement
        Returns:
        PreparedStatement
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • doesTableExist

        boolean doesTableExist(java.lang.String table)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        checks whether the specified table exists
        Parameters:
        table - name of table
        Returns:
        true, if the table exists, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • doesColumnExist

        boolean doesColumnExist(java.lang.String table,
                        java.lang.String column)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        checks whether the specified column exists
        Parameters:
        table - name of table
        column - name of column
        Returns:
        true, if the column exists, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • getColumnLength

        int getColumnLength(java.lang.String table,
                    java.lang.String column)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets the length of the specified column
        Parameters:
        table - name of table
        column - name of column
        Returns:
        the length of the column or -1 if no column with the given name in the given table exists
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • verifyConnection

        boolean verifyConnection()
        verifies that the connection i still working
        Returns:
        true, if the connection is valid; false otherwise
